bill.title: Establishing requirements for tactics and equipment used by peace officers.
bill.description: Establishing requirements for tactics and equipment used by peace officers.

history.action: Prefiled for introduction.
First reading, referred to Public Safety.
Public hearing in the House Committee on Public Safety at 8:00 AM.
Executive session scheduled, but no action was taken in the House Committee on Public Safety at 8:00 AM.
Executive session scheduled, but no action was taken in the House Committee on Public Safety at 1:30 PM.
Executive action taken in the House Committee on Public Safety at 10:00 AM.
PS - Majority; 1st substitute bill be substituted, do pass.
Minority; do not pass.
Minority; without recommendation.
Referred to Rules 2 Review.
Placed on second reading by Rules Committee.
1st substitute bill substituted
Floor amendment
Rules suspended. Placed on Third Reading.
Third reading, passed; yeas, 54; nays, 43; absent, 0; excused, 1.
First reading, referred to Law & Justice.
Public hearing in the Senate Committee on Law & Justice at 10:30 AM.
Executive action taken in the Senate Committee on Law & Justice at 10:30 AM.
LAW - Majority; do pass with amendment
Minority; do not pass.
Passed to Rules Committee for second reading.
Placed on second reading by Rules Committee.
Committee amendment not adopted.
Floor amendment
Rules suspended. Placed on Third Reading.
Third reading, passed; yeas, 27; nays, 22; absent, 0; excused, 0.
House refuses to concur in the Senate amendments. Asks Senate for Conference thereon.
Conference committee appointed. Representatives Johnson, J., Goodman, Mosbrucker.
Conference committee request granted.
Conference committee appointed. Senators Pedersen, Dhingra, Padden.
Conference committee report; received 10:15 AM 4/22/2021.
Signed by Senators Dhingra, Padden, Pedersen; Representatives Goodman, Johnson, J., Mosbrucker.
Conference committee report; received 10:19 AM 4/22/2021.
Conference committee report adopted.
Passed final passage as recommended by conference committee; yeas, 28; nays, 20; absent, 0; excused, 1.
Conference committee report adopted.
Passed final passage as recommended by conference committee; yeas, 55; nays, 42; absent, 0; excused, 1.
Speaker signed.
President signed.
Delivered to Governor.
Governor signed.
Chapter 320, 2021 Laws.
Effective date 7/25/2021.

subjects.subject_name: LAW ENFORCEMENT AND LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL

votes.desc: House Committee on Public Safety: 1st substitute bill be substituted, do pass
Senate Committee on Law & Justice: do pass with amendment(s)
Senate 3rd Reading & Final Passage as Amended by the Senate
Senate Final Passage as Recommended by Conference Committee
House Final Passage as recommended by the Conference Committee
